thread.title: Donald Trump ditched Super Bowl party with Patriots losing big
thread.title_full: Donald Trump ditched Super Bowl party with Patriots losing big

author: Brandon Schlager (bschlager@sportingnews.com)
title: Donald Trump ditched Super Bowl party with Patriots losing big
text:
NFL February 5, 2017 10:30pm EST February 5, 2017 10:30pm EST American Football, News, English, NFL, Atlanta Falcons, New England Patriots, Super Bowl The president made it no secret he was pulling for the Patriots to beat the Falcons in Super Bowl 51. He didn't stick around to watch it. Donald Trump (Getty Images) 
Updated at 10:30 p.m. ET 
Updated at 10:30 p.m. ET 
President Donald Trump made it no secret he was pulling for the Patriots to beat the Falcons in Super Bowl 51. 
But Trump didn't stick around his own party to watch as New England staged a historic comeback. 
MORE: Anti-Trump protesters march near NRG Stadium 
With friends Tom Brady, Bill Belichick and Co. trailing 28-3 in the third quarter, the White House press pool noted Trump departed Trump International Golf Club in West Palm Beach, Fla., where he was hosting a Super Bowl 51 party. The Patriots then scored 25 unanswered points to force overtime, where they won the championship on a James White touchdown. Trump's given up on the game, per pool. pic.twitter.com/YDoPEpitDR
